New Records: Corey Seager became the first left-handed-hitting shortstop in MLB history to hit 200 home runs during the game.
Key Match Events: Seager's 406-foot home run was the Rangers' first hit of the game off White Sox starter Nick Nastrini.
Nathan Eovaldi pitched seven scoreless innings with 10 strikeouts, striking out 6 of those with his four-seam fastball averaging 96.2 mph.
Post-Match Reflections: Rangers starter Nathan Eovaldi praised Seager's consistency and preparation.
Seager's double-play partner Marcus Semien highlighted the significance of Seager's milestone and their teamwork.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game marked the Rangers' completion of a three-game sweep over the White Sox.
Seager's milestone adds to the legacy of other notable shortstops like Francisco Lindor and Marcus Semien.
